intro: Microsperma rudis, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to sandy and rocky soils in arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. Microsperma rudis is adapted to survive in harsh environments through its succulent leaves and efficient water conservation mechanisms.
